intro: Erodium romanum var. masguindalii, commonly known as the Masguindal's common bedstraw, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, pink to purple flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and thrives in full sun. It has a low-growing habit with hairy stems and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. This variety is distinguished by its slightly different leaf morphology compared to the typical Erodium romanum.
